text: Hi! I'm here to help you chose a movie!
Terrific
What are some genres you like? What was the last movie you saw?
the last movie i saw in the theater was Hustlers . I generally like comedy, drama and documentaries
How did you like Hustlers? It definitely has the drama aspect, did it leave you wanting more or was it not exactly what you were looking for?
I liked it, it wasn't the most high-brow movie i've ever seen but it was fun. I like to just enjoy
And what are your thoughts on action in film?
I like some action. Just not too violent
Definitely, movies like Deadpool wouldn't be up your alley I'm guessing?
It could be. I understand Deadpool was very funny I like funny
Haha it definitely was, I think I have a suggestion for you though
Cool Whats that?

So it's the newA Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood, the Mr. Rogers movie with Tom Hanks as the actor. It's not as much a comedic relief, but I saw it in theatres with my roomates and it's honestly a super refreshing and incredibly well directed movie.
movie: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood (2019)
movie_name: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood

text: that sounds so good to me. I loved Mr. Rogers so much.. and Tom Hanks is a great actor
The combination is incredible to be honest, and it lets you understand his background and who he was as a person so much more
That sounds amazing. I would love to see that
Awesome, that's my recommendation then!
Great! That is totally what i'm going to see. I can't wait to watch the trailer
The trailer's awesome and it's even better in theater
Well then. Given the opportunity I will formally accept. Thank you so much for your help
Hi. My name is Becca. I'm here to help you find a movie trailer today. Would you mind starting by telling me your name?
Hey Becca! I'm Erica
Hi Erica. It's so nice to meet you!
Thank you - you as well! Can you help me find a movie?
I will try my best! What was the last movie you watched?
Skyscraper !
Oh that movie was awesome! I love The Rock.
You've seen it?! It was SO good. I've actually seen it a few times. What was your favorite part?
I'm a tech nerd so the specs about the actual building, and then watching the tour of the building was amazing. The architecture was so detailed.
It was ! I loved how they showed detail about the massive building as well. It truly was a beautiful building. Have you seen any good movies that are similar to Skyscraper?
Yes. I know of two big ones. They are a few years old. One is San Andreas which also features The Rock, and the other is any of the Die Hard movies.
I've honestly never seen any of the Die Hard movies. What are they about?

The first one is about a man who is an NYPD officer. He has to save his wife and other hostages being held at Nakatomi Plaza in LA. There are lots of scenes with impossible rescues, and tons of action.
That actually sounds really good! I'll have to check them out! Thank you so much for the recommendation
My pleasure. I just know you'll love them, and they are great if you love binge watching or weekend movie marathons.
I hope so! I've been looking for something to binge watch lately! Sounds like I'll have some great binge worthy movies !
I have the trailer available for you to watch as well.
Oh sure, I'd love to see it! Who plays the main character?
A much younger Bruce Willis
Ohh I love Bruce Willis ! He is such a great actor
He really is. I feel like he's what The Rock studied when he started acting. They had similar styles at the beginning.
Very interesting ! Well, I'm gonna go check it out! Thank you again for the recommendation!
Of course. I hope you enjoy it.:)
Hope so ! Enjoy your day!(:
Hi, Do you like movies a lot?
I do. I watch movies pretty often. Do you like movies?
Yes, Family are my favorite and drama. What is your favorite type of movie?
I like all sorts of movies like documentaries, comedies, scary movies, thrillers, dramas.
Wow, I think I know a movie you may like.
Okay. What do you recommend?
A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood telling the story of Mr. Rogers is beautiful and eloqunt.
movie: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood (2019)
movie_name: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood

text: I wanted to see that! Is that the one with Tom Hanks as Mr. Rogers.
Yes, Tom Hanks looks just like him in the movie. The resemblence is uncanny.
I appreciate and accept your recommendation.
Great I really hope you enjoy the movie. I can't wait to see it too.
Do you know when it comes out in theaters? Or is it already out?
It came out November 22, 2019 in the US
Oh okay. That is helpful. Did you see the documentary about Mr. Rogers that came out this past year?
Yes, that was heartwarming as well. I love his genuine passion for loving people.
Did you watch the show as a child?
Yes, I even met Mr. McFeeley once. That was exciting :)
You did?! That is very exciting.
I hope you enjoy the movie!
I will! Thank you again.
Hey there
Hi! I'm looking for recommendations on a great holiday movie, do you have any recommendations?
For sure! First, do you have certain preferences or aversions? Like are you into musicals?
I do not really like musicals.

Good to know... I would have recommended White Christmas, it's a classic and a bit of a tradition in our family, but there are so many to choose from! The old Tim Allen Santa Clause movie is super fun and so is Home Alone.
Is the Tim Allen Santa Clause movie funny? I would love to watch a funny movie.
Yes it is! It's a heart warming family comedy :)
I accept this recommendation and would love to watch it with my family! Thank you for your help.
You're very welcome! I hope you enjoy it!
If we finish this movie early, do you have children's Christmas movie to recommend? So far our favorite is Elf.
I would absolutely recommend Rise of the Guardians it's a kid's movie, but definitely funny so adults can enjoy too
I never knew Rise of the Guardian's Christmas movie. I'm sure we would love this recommendation too.
It's honestly kind of an all holiday theme. There's stuff in there about the Easter Bunny, and the Tooth Fairy and other characters like that. But there's definitely a dominant Christmas theme in it.
That's wonderful thank you for letting me know. Both of these movies seem like a great fit for my family. Thank you for your recommendations.
You're welcome! I hope you enjoy them. Happy Holidays to you and your family
You too!
Besides Elf, do you have any other favorites?
We really love Jim Carrey's How The Grinch Stole Christmas. It really makesmusnStole Christmas. It really makes us laugh and he took on the character so well. Have you ever seen it?
I have! It's been several years though. I always liked the original cartoon, but I can agree that Jim Carrey's performance was awesome and he really made it his own
I agree! Thank you for again for chatting with me and sending your recommendations. Happy holidays.
Thanks you too!

anything with scorsese i usually enjoy

that is a deniro film that I actually have not seen yer

Hello, I hear that you are seeking a movie recommendation. Tell me about your movie preferences?
I like action adventure and horror movies.
Oh nice! Me too! I've recently watched The Ring, have you heard of it? It's really old, from 2002 I believe. It was a movie I watched as a kid.
I heard of it and I think I watched it a while back but it was so long ago. I think they did remake a more recent version of it, did you watch the remake of it?

No, I don't believe I've seen a remake. I think there was a sequel that came out a while back, but that's as far as I've gone with this. What recent movies have you seen? Have you seen Zombieland? Not sure if that's a horror movie, though. Sure sounds like it.

I recently watched the new Halloween with michael myers and Anabelle. I haven't seen Zombieland but I think its a comedy if im correct. What horror movies would you suggest watching that came out in 2019?
Have you seen Annabelle Comes Homes? Something about a haunted doll always gives me chills.
I haven't seen that one, I might check it out. I saw the first one.
So would you like to watch this movie trailer?
Yes I would like to watch the trailer.
Here is a link to the trailer.
It looks better than the first anabelle. I will def check this one out.
I know you said you liked action adventure and horror, I guess we jumped right to it. I can recommend an action adventure movie as well if you'd like.
I am open to hear.
Have you seen Angel Has Fallen. I am a big fan of Gerard Butler.
No, I haven't heard of that movie before. Is it any good?

I have not seen that one, but I know it came out this year. It is actually a movie that I plan on watching since it is a sequel to a movie that I have seen and really loved called Olympus Has Fallen, which had a very dystopian type theme.
I think I would want to watch it to see if it is good.

I think it would be better to watch the first of the Fallen movies, which is Olympus Had Fallen even though it is old, but if you end up liking it, you can then watch the movie that came out this year. How does that sound?
I agree, the movie before might set the tone and help me better undersand Angel has fallen.

Los Angeles policeman Lt. Marion Cobra Cobretti (Sylvester Stallone) finds himself at the center of a spate of murders carried out by a secret society called New Order: killers who select weak members of society for extermination. As Cobra falls for Ingrid, they find shelter in a small town, but must soon fight for survival.

Denny Swift is a Formula One race car driver who understands that the techniques needed on the racetrack can also be used to successfully navigate everyday life. 1984 is my exact favorite book actually... As for the King movies IT (Both the 90's one and the remake), Cat's Eye (I think that was him), Pet Cemetery one and two (From back in the day)... Gosh it's been awhile. Gerald's Game. There were a few others but they were all years ago. Fun fact: He used to due the Stan Lee thing where he stuck himself into the movies as a cameo.

Hello, I'm here to help find you a movie trailer!
Excellent. I appreciate the help. I want to find a good movie to take my girlfriend to this weekend.
What was the last movie you two saw together, did she enjoy it?
The last movie we saw together was Star Wars Rise of Skywalker which she enjoyed but admittedly, we saw it for me. She enjoys comedies more than action.
Haha, ok. Are you looking for more of a general comedy film or something perhaps more romantic?
I'd be willing to go with either or one that's both. I'm just not sure what's out there in those categories.
Is there an actor or actress in particular that you know she likes?
She likes Ryan Reynolds. The Deadpool guy. She even says I look a little him. I don't see it. Maybe like his older brother. She loved him and Sandra Bullock in The Proposal.
Alright, let me see what I can find!
Thanks for the help. I appreciate it very much. I'm looking forward to spending time together and treating her to a good movie.
How do you feel about Jumanji: The Next Level? It's a mix of goofy comedy and action with the likes of Kevin Heart, Jack Black, and Dwayne Johnson.
That has potential. Isn't Dwayne Johnson The Rock?
Yup, I think he dropped the moniker awhile back when he got serious about acting.
Right. That does look good and I'll make that first on my list. But do have one more recommendation for me as a back-up plan?
Shockingly there isn't a lot in theaters at the moment, would you be opposed to watching something at home? Otherwise there's Sonic and Bad Boys for Life.
I'll take a look at both of those. If we do decide to stay home, is there a romantic comedy that you recommend?

If you don't mind watching something a little older, the original Overboard with Kurt Russell and Goldie Hawn. Those two have been an adorable couple in Hollywood for years and the film is a classic romantic comedy as far as I'm concerned. I can tell you a little bit about it if you're interested.
The classics are always a nice switch. Tell me about it!

Goldie Hawn plays an uptight high society type who cheats the carpenter (Kurt Russell) who is working on her yacht. After an accident gives her amnesia, he finds her and convinces her they're husband and wife. It sounds a bit dodgy but it's actually pretty adorable, especially when his kids get involved.
Awww. That actually sounds perfect! Even if we see something in the theater, I'm definitely taking this recommendation. Thank you so much for your help!
Great, I really hope you two enjoy whatever you decide to see! I'll send the trailer for Overboard straight away, bye and take care.
